paper_abstract: The potential for transient optical power excursions to disrupt transmission is well established in transparent wavelength division multiplexed systems. This paper will describe experiments that examine the evolution of such excursions in erbium doped fiber amplifier based systems with reconfigured channel assignment at transparent nodes along the propagation path. The primary physical effects that couple excursions between different channels will be identified and characterized in terms of the channel loading, distance, time, and radio frequency (RF) dependence. paper_title: Channel Power Transients in Erbium Doped Fiber Amplified Reconfigurable Transmission Systems
